snippet: A troubling campaign proposal by the front-running party in the current national elections could mean revising a “no first use” policy.
abstract: Editorial expresses fear that India's Bharatiya Janata Party, presumed front-runner in national elections, may abandon 'no first use' policy in country's nuclear doctrine; says changing policy, would exacerbate tensions with China and Pakistan; holds that election winner would do better to improve ties with Pakistan and seek arms control initiative throughout region, rather than abandon doctrine.
lead_paragraph: A troubling campaign proposal by the front-running party in the current national elections could mean revising a “no first use” policy.

headline.main: A Risk to India’s Nuclear Doctrine
headline.print_headline: A Risk to India’s Nuclear Doctrine
